intro: Stenorrhynchos hassleri, commonly known as the Hassler's stenorrhynchos, is a species of flowering plant in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
